channel.title: Client + source?
channel.description:
Can i use any client with any source?
Also what does the source contain that the client doesn;t? Like whati s the source used for and what is the client used for? I know the client is to run it but theres many things in the client that are methods which go inside the game

item.title: Client + source?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Fierystr, post:1, topic:394173”]Can i use any client with any source?

Also what does the source contain that the client doesn;t? Like whati s the source used for and what is the client used for? I know the client is to run it but theres many things in the client that are methods which go inside the game[/quote]

The terminology people use on these forums still causes problems I see.

“The source” refers to the source code, or the .java files that are compiled to run an application. On the forums, this is often used to mean the “server source”.

A server is essentially what the client connects to, and processes the logic of the game.

A client is essentially anything that connects to a server. When playing a game, the client is what you directly interact with.

Read full topic
